metadata.dcterms:title: Social Cognitive Theory, leisure time physical activity, and mental health in Chinese university students
metadata.dcterms:creator: Curtin, Kimberley
metadata.dcterms:description: This data was collected in China with undergraduate students. The variables of interest are leisure time physical activity, self-efficacy, social support, intention to be physically active, access to places to be physically active, self-construal, subjective well-being (affect and satisfaction with life).
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
Social Sciences
social cognitive theory
self-construal
